passage.text: The Million Women Study: design and characteristics of the study population

By the end of 2002, statistical power of the Million Women Study will be sufficient to show that current users of hormone replacement therapy have a relative risk of 0.8 or greater, or 1.2 or higher than those who have never used the therapy for breast and other cancers, colorectal cancer, lung and ovarian cancer disease, ischaemic heart disease (ICR), and stroke.

At the secondary lymphoid organs, efficient interactions between T, B and antigen-presenting cells occur. T cells are primarily located in the paracortical zone, which includes interfollicular regions. Small primary fojicles inthe cortex become secondary fungus or germinal centres (GCs) after antigenic stimulation. Technically, the development of the GC reaction is mediated by both cellular contacts and humoral factors such as CD40L (assisted metochortic acid) expressed by T cell also activated B cells that produce memory B
We predicted ten years ago that biotechnology would face new ethical challenges.
